intro: Gyrostachys comosa, commonly known as the hairy goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite and covered in fine, soft hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry environments. The flowers are clustered in spikes and bloom during the warmer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
